title: How Macron and Lecornu learned to govern without a majority
subhead: By giving his prime minister more leeway, the French president abandoned his 'Jupiterian' style of leadership. In return, he has regained space to weigh in on issues beyond his usual prerogatives.

title: Trump battles Minneapolis shooting fallout as agents put on leave
Springsteen dedicates fiery ode to the people of Minneapolis
Escaped Syrian detainees recount chaos after Kurdish forces withdraw
subhead: The security handover of prisons and detention camps from the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) to the authorities in Damascus took place amid total confusion, allowing several dozen prisoners to escape. Each side has blamed the other for the incident.

title: John Bolton: 'Toppling the Iranian regime is the most effective way to remove the terrorist threat the West has faced'
subhead: The former US national security adviser argues, in an op-ed for Le Monde, that the EU stands out for its passivity in the face of the Islamic Republic, while that dictatorship carries out assassinations of dissidents in Europe, supports international terrorism and poses a nuclear threat.

title: French senate adopts a bill to ease the return of colonial-era artifacts to their countries of origin
subhead: The new legislation aims to broaden the restitution of colonial-era assets, introducing clear criteria and a transparent process for handling requests from the countries involved.

title: Denmark's long and difficult reckoning with America's abandonment
subhead: Since the end of the Cold War, the Scandinavian kingdom pursued a 'super-Atlanticist' strategy in hopes that the US would come to its aid when needed. Now, trust between Washington and Copenhagen has been broken.

title: 2026 World Cup: Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass urges the Trump administration to reassure international fans
Sweden lowers criminal responsibility to age 13
White House and Slovak PM deny report on Trump's mental state
Veteran civil servant Xavier Piechaczyk to head Paris public transports
Plane crashes near Colombia and Venezuela border, killing 15
Charles Kushner, Trump's man in Paris
France backs EU move to label Iran's Revolutionary Guards a terrorist group

France is still trading uranium with Russia, nearly four years after Ukraine invasion
French finance minister urges Capgemini explain its contract with ICE
French senators reject assisted dying bill, send it back to lower house
Havana, a ghost town battered by shortages and US threats
2026 FIFA World Cup: Calls for boycott emerge to bring Trump 'to his senses'
subhead: The US president's desire to claim Greenland has prompted political figures to raise the possibility of national football teams withdrawing.

title: How India and the EU created a common market to counter Trump
subhead: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and representatives of the European Union concluded a trade agreement on January 27, after nearly 20 years of intermittent negotiations, opening up a market of nearly two billion people.

title: Why there are so many French presidential hopefuls
subhead: As a result of political fragmentation, the growing number of figures who have declared their candidacies or are thinking about doing so is making the 2027 presidential election highly uncertain, writes Le Monde's Solenn de Royer in her column.

title: A pragmatic trade agreement between India and the EU
